intro: Vavaea bougainvillensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, papery bracts that surround its small, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Vavaea bougainvillensis thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and moist lowlands.
